Bio

Studies

PhD. in Machine Learning, University of Sheffield.
Thesis: "Gaussian Processes for Spatiotemporal Modelling"
Supervisor: Prof. Neil D. Lawrence

MSc. in Statistics and Operational Research, University of Essex.
Thesis: "Non-Biological Correlations Within Aï¬€ymetrix GeneChip"
Supervisor: Prof. Graham J. G. Upton

BSc. in Actuarial Science, Autonomous Technological Institute of Mexico.
Thesis: "IBNR reserves estimation with Generalized Linear Models"
Supervisor: Prof. Enrique de Alba Guerra

Experience

Research Partner at the UN Global Pulse - Kampla. I joined a team of data scientists, to help devolop new tools to analyze and visualize infectious diseases data. The goal was to contribute with the Health Service in Uganda, providing them accurate and timely information.

Technical Coordinator at the National Institute of Statistics and Geography (INEGI), in Mexico. I was mainly involved in the assessment of methodologies for information production and the revision of the regulatory framework of the National Information System.

I also worked for the National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV), in Mexico. My responsibilities were credit risk analysis of banks portfolios and assessment of the banks technical methodologies for determining capital requirements.
